item.title: TripAdvisor simplifies the process of capturing important moments during a trip
item.description: TripAdvisor, the biggest travel website globally as of July 2015 according to comScore Media Metrix, has introduced a “Travel Timeline” feature for its mobile app. This feature allows users to record and share their travel experiences. When turned on, it automatically generates a timeline of the places visited and photos taken at each location. This timeline can be viewed chronologically or as a route on a map. Adam Medros, TripAdvisor’s SVP of Global Product, highlights the feature’s value in documenting and sharing travel memories.

item.title: Bahrain becomes a member of the Cruise Arabia Alliance
item.description: Bahrain has joined the Cruise Arabia Alliance, solidifying the organization’s presence in the region. Other members include Abu Dhabi, Dubai, Sharjah, Qatar, and Oman. The alliance promotes collaboration among its members to maintain high standards of service for cruise lines and their passengers. This announcement took place at the Seatrade Middle East Cruise Forum in Doha, Qatar, hosted by the Qatar Tourism Authority (QTA). Alongside this news, Bahrain also shared that the 2015/2016 cruise season will include 68,000 passengers and 32 visits from major cruise lines.

item.title: ViaVii is providing assistance with travel arrangements in Qatar
item.description: Travelers visiting Qatar for leisure or major events can now create personalized itineraries through ViaVii, a platform for booking unique travel experiences. ViaVii connects visitors with local experiences, such as Qatari cooking classes, art scene exploration, cultural storytelling, desert overnight stays, and heritage walks. Rola Fayyad, founder and CEO of ViaVii, recognized that travelers to the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region often struggle to find experiences that allow for cultural immersion and personal connections.

item.title: Etihad, TCA Abu Dhabi, and Miral collaborate to showcase Abu Dhabi as a preferred destination
item.description: Etihad Airways has partnered with the Abu Dhabi Tourism & Culture Authority (TCA Abu Dhabi) and Miral Asset Management (Miral) to enhance Abu Dhabi’s standing as a top global destination for tourism, business, and culture. This collaboration will see the three entities working together to attract more visitors and stopover travelers to Abu Dhabi. Joint efforts will include marketing and communication initiatives, sharing market insights and data, developing loyalty programs, and organizing business and leisure events both within the Emirate and internationally.

item.title: TripAdvisor has announced the winners of the Travelers' Choice awards for world landmarks
item.description: TripAdvisor, the popular travel website, has revealed the winners of its Travelers’ Choice awards for top global attractions. Now in their second year, the awards recognized 929 attractions, with a special highlight on the top 25. Asian and Middle Eastern landmarks secured four spots in the global top ten, while an Australian park earned a coveted place among the top ten parks worldwide. item.title: Bangkok is the top tourist destination in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: Source: Mastercard. Report cover. Although Bangkok, Thailand remains the top spot for visitors in the Asia Pacific, the latest Mastercard Asia Pacific Destinations Index 2017* shows that Singapore outpaces the Thai capital in total tourist spending. Singapore experienced an 18% increase in visitor spending between 2015 and 2016. As one of just five destinations in the top 20 for overall expenditure to hit a minimum daily spend of US$200, Singapore drew in the biggest spenders at US$254 per day.

item.title: A white paper providing solutions for talent management in the Chinese hospitality industry
item.description: Florida International University’s Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management (CSHTM) and its Institute for Hospitality & Tourism Education & Research (IHTER) have published a new resource for HR professionals and hospitality businesses, particularly those working with Chinese markets. The white paper, titled “Managing Growing Pains of China’s Relentless Hotel Development Pipeline,” examines the significant lack of qualified talent within China’s rapidly expanding hotel industry. The paper offers practical solutions such as professional development programs, conflict resolution strategies, and clearly defined career paths to attract and retain skilled employees.
